{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:43.039
    | text      = And now he's on that side.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:44.560
    | text      = Like this is a thought that he never would have needed to confront were it not for a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:49.039
    | text      = bullshit content grist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:51.239
    | text      = Yeah, and he never would have had a reason for it to be something he needs to do because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:55.560
    | text      = he needs to defend Trump.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:14:56.840
    | text      = And the only way to do it in his mind is to like, oh yeah, I mean, fucking let's do this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:01.619
    | text      = So the more Trump does dumb shit, the more they reveal exactly what's underneath that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:07.119
    | text      = has been there the whole time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:08.479
    | text      = Yeah, and I guess that's something that's interesting about focusing on what we focus
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:11.880
    | text      = on is that like it's less interesting that Trump said X.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:15.520
    | text      = It's more interesting how Alex responds to X and how it makes the people who love Trump
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:20.399
    | text      = respond to X.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:21.399
    | text      = Yeah, it's fascinating because you're like, I would never have even expected people to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:26.279
    | text      = really think colonialism was still okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:29.220
    | text      = But it turns out a lot of people are like, why did manifest destiny stop?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:33.640
    | text      = Yeah, it's troubling.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:35.359
    | text      = So here's another example.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:38.600
    | text      = Hawaiian islands.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:39.680
    | text      = That was the worst.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:40.680
    | text      = No, that was not a purchase.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:43.680
    | text      = Dumb American.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:44.680
    | text      = That was not a purchase.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:46.239
    | text      = As someone who spent some years of his childhood growing up in Hawaii, I can tell you firsthand
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:50.119
    | text      = there are still some not great feelings about the process in which the island nation was
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:54.359
    | text      = brought into the United States.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:56.199
    | text      = I have a lot of fond memories of my dad taking me out of school early so we could go to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:15:59.800
    | text      = courthouse for the big King Kamehameha Day celebration.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:02.840
    | text      = Legitimately, some of my best memories are things like that from my time living on the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:06.199
    | text      = island of Oahu, taking part in celebration of a culture that was not my own.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:10.520
    | text      = But I was welcomed into the celebration all the same.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:13.760
    | text      = That was not the full experience of growing up white in Hawaii.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:16.399
    | text      = There was definitely a good amount of racism thrown my way just because I was white.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:20.680
    | text      = And that's never great.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:21.800
    | text      = But as an adult, I kind of understand it in a little bit of a larger context.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:26.640
    | text      = The early history of the Hawaiian islands is difficult to get into, basically, because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:31.000
    | text      = all the islands have their own stories.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:33.199
    | text      = They weren't completely like a united thing through a lot of history and even had conflicts
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:37.560
    | text      = between each other from time to time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:39.880
    | text      = Because getting into that is endlessly complicated, though there are some amazing tales that exist
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:43.760
    | text      = in that canon, I'm going to choose to start our story today in 1922, because that's when
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:48.479
    | text      = James Dole, the owner of the Hawaiian Pineapple Company, which would become Dole, bought the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:52.840
    | text      = island of Lanai.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:55.159
    | text      = Lanai became almost entirely a pineapple plantation, and I remember in my youth being told that
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:16:59.439
    | text      = normal people like me were not allowed to go to Lanai because it was wholly owned by
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:03.279
    | text      = Dole.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:04.279
    | text      = I imagined showing up on Lanai would be something not unlike that scene in the Leonardo DiCaprio
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:08.479
    | text      = movie The Beach, where Leo accidentally stumbles into a giant marijuana farm on an island,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:13.119
    | text      = but this would be with pineapples.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:15.199
    | text      = It wasn't, the island isn't closed off to people anymore, but it might have been when
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:19.699
    | text      = I was there, because the pineapple plantations were still operational until the time I lived
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:25.260
    | text      = in Honolulu.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:26.260
    | text      = Yeah, it was more like Leonardo DiCaprio and Django Unchained than The Beach.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:30.079
    | text      = It may have been.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:31.579
    | text      = By then, the Lanai plantation was a smaller operation, though, and it was run by Del Monte,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:36.819
    | text      = because Dole had fled Hawaii in search of cheaper labor.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:40.140
    | text      = The pineapple business in Hawaii was very big, and Lanai boasted the largest such plantation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:44.899
    | text      = in the world, which understandably gave James Dole a very powerful position in the islands.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:49.920
    | text      = Flashback to 1795.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:52.479
    | text      = King Kamehameha has united the islands into a single kingdom.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:17:56.399
    | text      = His descendants rule until 1872, the line ending with the death of the childless King
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:00.960
    | text      = Kamehameha V.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:02.840
    | text      = With no heir, chaos descended on the process of determining the next ruler.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:07.020
    | text      = When things got a little bit out of hand, Western forces stepped in to quell the violence,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:11.180
    | text      = ultimately leading to the ascension of King Kalakua.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:15.140
    | text      = Although initially on friendly terms with Western interests, in time Kalakua began entertaining
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:21.359
    | text      = ideas of creating a federation of Polynesian states, each independent and sovereign, but
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:26.220
    | text      = cooperative in their interests.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:28.380
    | text      = This was not something that the Western business interests wanted to see happen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:32.560
    | text      = Things were all right for their business interests as it was, but if Polynesian states got together,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:37.939
    | text      = they could ultimately jeopardize their corporate power through exports and trade.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:42.060
    | text      = Labor unionizing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:43.060
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:44.060
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:45.060
    | text      = So on July 6, 1887, King Kalakua was literally forced at gunpoint to sign a new constitution
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:50.640
    | text      = for Hawaii that was written by the white business owners and was designed to disenfranchise
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:55.260
    | text      = the native population and make it easier for their businesses to run roughshod over nature
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:18:59.500
    | text      = and the native peoples.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:01.239
    | text      = It's remembered by its appropriate name, the Bayonet Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:05.579
    | text      = The men who made Kalakua sign the constitution were members of a group called the Hawaiian
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:09.819
    | text      = League, which was comprised of sugar and pineapple business owners, missionaries, and lawyers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:15.260
    | text      = This was legitimately a white secret society aimed at overthrowing the kingdom of Hawaii
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:19.939
    | text      = and getting the U.S. to annex the islands.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:23.159
    | text      = They exerted their control by joining up with a local white militia called the Honolulu
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:26.659
    | text      = Rifles, who were literally the ones pointing the guns during the signing of the Bayonet
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:31.539
    | text      = Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:32.539
    | text      = The new constitution took much of the power away from the monarch and gave that power
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:35.819
    | text      = to the legislature.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:37.340
    | text      = Generally, democratization, when it's not forced at gunpoint, is a good thing, but this
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:41.859
    | text      = constitution also specified and put in place new requirements for voting rights that would
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:46.939
    | text      = disenfranchise most of the native population of the island, leaving only the white settlers
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:51.560
    | text      = and business owners as the ones who could elect the members of the legislature.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:19:55.939
    | text      = To get elected, even, one had to, quote, own real estate within the kingdom of clear value.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:01.659
    | text      = Kalakua's cabinet was dismissed, some fleeing the country under feelings that they were
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:08.180
    | text      = going to be killed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:09.859
    | text      = And then that cabinet was...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:10.859
    | text      = Wise.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:11.859
    | text      = Wise feelings.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:12.859
    | text      = Possibly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:13.859
    | text      = Wise feelings.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:14.859
    | text      = And the cabinet was then replaced by members of the Hawaiian League.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:18.119
    | text      = This was not democratization.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:19.579
    | text      = This was a coup.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:20.579
    | text      = Yep.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:21.579
    | text      = Just like Georgia.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:22.579
    | text      = Kalakua died...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:23.579
    | text      = Not the country.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:24.739
    | text      = Brian Kemp.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:25.739
    | text      = Oh, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:26.739
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:27.739
    | text      = Kalakua died in 1891 and was succeeded by his sister, Queen Liliuokalani, who is recognized
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:33.539
    | text      = as the last monarch of Hawaii.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:35.800
    | text      = When Liliuokalani rose to the throne, she made it clear that it was her intention to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:39.539
    | text      = restore power to the monarchy, specifically targeting the business interests that had
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:43.579
    | text      = been behind the original coup.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:45.979
    | text      = That scared the shit out of the business owners and members of the Hawaiian League, who had
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:49.859
    | text      = by now changed their name to the Committee of Safety.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:54.140
    | text      = The goal of the actions of the white settlers up to this point had always been aimed at
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:57.579
    | text      = the annexation of Hawaii.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:20:59.380
    | text      = They really wanted the United States to take over Hawaii.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:03.060
    | text      = Most of the momentum was...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:04.060
    | text      = It's a lot easier to suppress people whenever you got the whole United States behind you.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:08.279
    | text      = Most of the momentum was coming from Americans who wanted to take the islands, but they also
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:11.619
    | text      = used the fear that if we didn't do it, the British or the Japanese would to rally politicians
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:16.340
    | text      = to their side.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:17.819
    | text      = Nationalism being used in a negative...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:20.100
    | text      = I don't...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:21.100
    | text      = No.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:22.100
    | text      = What was in the way of their ability to achieve their goals was the monarchy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:25.939
    | text      = Liliuokalani was clear in her position that she stood against annexation, and thus the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:29.779
    | text      = members of the Committee for Safety knew that they had to actually overthrow the queen,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:34.060
    | text      = which is what they paved the way to do in order to help pave the way for the United
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:38.159
    | text      = States to have no reason to not annex.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:41.579
    | text      = On January 14th, 1893, Queen Liliuokalani gave a speech indicating her intention to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:47.260
    | text      = invalidate the Bayonet Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:49.899
    | text      = She made clear she would not seek to, quote, deprive one white man of any legitimate right,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:54.500
    | text      = but she quite accurately also pointed out that, quote, any newly arrived white man without
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:21:59.199
    | text      = interests or intention of residence is placed as a voter above the heads of thousands of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:03.119
    | text      = my subjects to whom God had given these islands and no other home.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:07.880
    | text      = She presented cabinet ministers with the new constitution that she wanted to enact, which
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:11.800
    | text      = they refused to sign before fleeing the government building, afraid of the crowds of Hawaiians
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:15.859
    | text      = who had gathered to support the queen.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:18.180
    | text      = The Committee of Safety held a meeting on January 16th where they decided to frame their
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:22.140
    | text      = coming actions as purely a means to protect the lives and property of white citizens,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:27.020
    | text      = pretending there was a noble reason for their clear incitement and conspiracy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:30.979
    | text      = Their reasons for framing the situation like this was because they knew that the U.S. military
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:34.520
    | text      = would not openly support their efforts to overthrow the queen, but they would intervene
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:38.920
    | text      = to protect U.S. citizens.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:40.899
    | text      = If the illusion was created that that's what they were needed for, you could get the military
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:45.239
    | text      = into play.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:47.239
    | text      = Charles Burnett Wilson, the marshal of the kingdom, caught wind of the overthrow plot
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:51.079
    | text      = and attempted to get arrest warrants for the members of the committee who were agitating
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:54.520
    | text      = against the government.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:55.739
    | text      = But because they were all well-placed businesspeople with connections in the legislature, the requests
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:22:59.800
    | text      = were denied.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:00.800
    | text      = His quote at the time was, I don't think they're really interested in safety at all, guys.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:06.640
    | text      = I think this whole name thing, I think they're fucking with us.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:10.680
    | text      = Knowing that there was trouble brewing, Wilson started gathering a posse to try and protect
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:14.399
    | text      = the queen, but it was pointless.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:16.159
    | text      = The committee had used their narrative to bring the U.S. military into the city and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:19.319
    | text      = the defenders of the throne were no match for the forces behind the coup.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 01:23:22.960
